title.narrative: Protection of human rights, access to justice and gender equality

description.narrative: The areas of intervention in Sphere 3 are linked to two (out of four) DGF II high-level outcomes and specifically highlighted in bold as follows: To increase protection and fulfilment of human rights and gender equality; and to strengthen rule of law and improved access to justice for all citizens. This sphere is distinct in nature from Spheres 1 and 2, as it is essentially a sphere targeting themes of overarching importance. Although sphere 3 could technically have been merged in Spheres 1 and 2, the themes of human rights, access to justice, violence and conflict mitigation and gender equality are overarching priorities that need to be targeted separately. Furthermore, these themes are aligned with Uganda's Human Rights National; Action Plan (NAP) objectives, SDGs and donors’ key priorities. The main purpose is to keep an advocacy focus on both implementation of existing pro human rights and legislative frameworks, and ensuring that government takes its responsibility by providing the means through legal aid for the most marginalised.

sector.narrative: 3.4 Addressing Transitioonal Justice, Violence, Torture and Impunity
